# {{lb|ja|part of speech|sort=しょすうし'}} [[counter]] [[word]], a Japanese part of speech

====Usage notes====
In Japanese, numerals cannot quantify nouns by themselves, except in certain cases for the numbers from one to ten (and then only using the forms ending in ''-tsu'', such as ''hitotsu'' or ''futatsu''). Instead, {{m|ja|助数詞||counter words|sc=Jpan}} are used after the number to count objects and events.

For example, {{m|ja|匹|tr=hiki|sc=Jpan}} is the counter for small animals:
* {{ja-usex|犬二'''匹'''|いぬ に'''ひき'''|"two dogs" (literally "dog two-small-animal")}}
